newsitem.title: USA: China's Legend to use AMD K5 chips in PCs.
newsitem.headline: China's Legend to use AMD K5 chips in PCs.

text.p: Advanced Micro Devices said Legend Group Co, China's largest domestic manufacturer of personal computers, will use the AMD-K5 processor to power its new Legend E-series desktop PCs.
Advanced Micro said Legend introduced the new E-series PCs Wedenesday at a press conference held in Beijing, China.
The Legend E-series line features three models designed for China's desktop computing market.
AMD said its K5 75-, 90- and 100-megahertz chips enable system performance equal to or better than rival Intel Corp chips running at similar clock speeds, based on P-Rating performance tests.
